In what veneration the Jerusalem Sanhedrim was held everywhere amongst all sorts of Jews may be collected from this: that the rule and determination concerning intercalating the year, concerning the beginning of the year, and the ap- pointed time of the feasts, &a came from it3 as also that was esteemed. the keeper and repository of the oral law.

ΙΙΙ. The judgment of life and death, in the matter of heresy and heterodoxy, belonged only to the Jerusalem San- hedrim: and it is some such thing that is now before us. The Christians were to be sent from the synagogues bound to Jerusalem, that is they would not deny their saith they might be condemned to die. The synagogues by their three menk might scourge them, but they could not pass sentence of death: and these goodly men conceived there was no other way to extirpate Christianity but by the death of Christians.
